page.title: 20HUNWICK METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: New Hunwick Primitive Methodist Church was built in 1875 & was the first of 2 Methodist churches.When built, the only form heating was from a big coal fireplace.Services have been held weekly ever since then, and Centenery Celebrations were held 10 years ago.A Sunday School was held every week until about 3 years ago, when it closed down due lack of support.However after 2 years there was a renewed interest, & in October 1984 a Sunday School was re-opened & has been a great success ever since. There are 60 pupils on the books & the average weekly attendance is 40.Since it restarted, two plays have been performed, & this year a Sunday School Anniversary - a concert of children's songs & recitations - is due to be held.Sunday School Outingsto the seaside & Leisure parks are popular.
